properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rainfall amounts of 15 to 30 millimetres are expected over these regions by late tonight. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Update: Air Quality Due To Wildfire
properties.Summary:
Description: The wildfire continues to burn southwest of Biggar. The State of Emergency is still active due to poor air quality due to shifting smoke from the fire. Emergency services personnel request that citizens stay away from the area.

properties.Title: Les Suêtes Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Southeasterly winds gusting to 100 km/h are expected to the lee of the Highlands tonight and Thursday morning. ### Les Suêtes wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Ice build-up due to freezing rain is expected or occurring. Extended period of significant freezing rain today. Freezing rain will transition to rain over most areas along the coast this afternoon, while inland and higher elevation areas will see mainly freezing rain. Conditions will improve tonight but are expected to deteriorate again on Thursday as another storm approaches Newfoundland. It will bring freezing rain, snow and ice pellets changing through to rain from Thursday morning through Friday morning. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-24T22:29:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-24T13:30:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2881479952.2019

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 15 cm is expected. Snow at times heavy mixed with ice pellets is expected today. Total accumulations of 15 to 20 cm are forecast before the snow tapers off late this afternoon or early this evening. Conditions will improve tonight but are expected to deteriorate again on Thursday as another storm approaches Newfoundland. It will bring a second round of snow from Thursday afternoon through Friday morning. Significant snowfall amounts are possible and warnings will likely be continued for this event. Further details will be provided in subsequent forecasts. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Title: Storm Surge Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: We expect higher than normal water levels near the coast this morning. Coastal flood warning issued jointly by Fisheries and Oceans Canada (Science) and the Meteorological Service of Canada - Quebec Region on 2019-04-24. A low pressure system over Southern Quebec will bring moderate to strong winds over the Quebec City area this morning. These winds combined with the high flow of the St Lawrence River and the current run of high-amplitude tidal ranges could cause flooding along the entire coast in and around the following localities, on the dates and at the times specified (Eastern Daylight Time). Note that the flooding in question may be more significant that what we observed during the last few days. Quebec City: 2019-04-24, from 09:00 AM to 12:00 PM. ### Coastal flooding is possible along the shoreline. Storm surge warnings are issued when water levels pose a threat to coastal regions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-24T17:59:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-24T08:29:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2220523891.2019
Area: Québec area, Côte-de-Beaupré - L'Île d'Orléans area, Bellechasse area, Lévis area

properties.Title: Wreckhouse Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Very strong wind gusts are expected or occurring Strong easterly winds are forecast to develop tonight in the Wreckhouse area. Winds gusting to 110 km/h will develop overnight and further increase to 140 km/h by Thursday morning. Winds are expected to diminish below warning criteria late in the day on Thursday. ### Drivers may lose control of their vehicles; tall vehicles are at risk of being overturned. Wreckhouse wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-04-25T05:33:02-00:00

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm is expected. A strong low pressure system tracking across northern Hudson Bay will give 10 to 15 cm of snow to Rankin Inlet today, while 15 to 25 cm are expected for Coral Harbour today through tonight. Freezing rain now appears less likely for Rankin Inlet and Whale Cove, although a risk of freezing rain remains for the early morning hours. The snow should end early this evening at Rankin Inlet and Whale Cove, and finally pull out of Coral Harbour early Thursday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-25T00:25:55-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-24T08:26:55-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0758457518.2019
Area: Rankin Region including Whale Cove, Coral Harbour
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with gusty winds and visibility frequently near zero in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. A strong pressure gradient over northern Yukon will cause strong easterly winds of 80 km/h gusting to 100 near the Richardson Mountains. Combined with light snow, these winds will cause blowing snow and reduce visibility to near zero. These blizzard conditions will persist this morning then ease later today. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Road closures are possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-04-24T21:59:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-04-24T11:27:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0992693713.2019
Area: Dempster

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong easterly winds gusting to 100 km/h are expected early this morning in areas prone to enhanced, downslope winds. Winds will begin to diminish later this morning. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Title: Weather Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A mixture of ice pellets, snow, and occasional freezing rain is expected today. Total accumulation of 5 to 10 cm of ice pellets are forecast before the ice pellets taper off this evening. Travel will be hazardous in these areas. Please consider postponing non-essential travel. Another storm is forecast to affect Newfoundland on Thursday and early Friday. Snow will redevelop midday on Thursday and persist until Friday morning. Significant snowfall amounts are possible and warnings will likely be required for the this event. Further details will be provided in subsequent forecasts. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
